column4: well, if any devs are listening, aside from the annoyances of moving to gnome (which really does feel like it's about 10 years behind KDE), nice distro!  Very well executed!  Keep up the good work.  I appreciate seeing the posts on bugtraq as well - lets me know the dev team is interested in keeping up with things.
but the distro behind it makes it worthwhile
gnome is not dumbed down. it just doesn't expect you to make it work properly yourself.
why force the user into understanding fifty million different options, when you can make things 'just work'?
gnome is so sumbed down - I'd like to be able to customize my menubar without looking in obscure, counter-intuitive places, and don't get me started about the whole win95-style filebrowser
the menu editing issue is well known; it's hidden because it doesn't work well.
the gtk+ 2.5 file browser is great.
the distro is impressive because it was designed with some of the same objectives as gnome.
because there is no point responding unless it gets ridiculous.
and i would ask you to not encourage it by responding ni future.
